data.title: NIKON NIKKOR LENS PATENT DATABASE
data.text:
Introduction

This database attempts to find the best (not necessarily exact) patent match for a production Nikkor lens. Note that the match is not always perfect as the final production lens can sometimes be different from the patent that is identified as the best match. Where possible this is indicated in the table below.

Last Updated 11 July 2024

Additional Resources

It is my hope that one day we will be able to evaluate the optical designs in these patents using freely available Open Source software. As of today the best Open Source software is Michael Hayford's ray-optics. There is a growing collections of patents analysed using ray-optics in this repository.

I also recommend following sites as great sources of information regarding Nikkor lenses.

Nikkor Thousand and One Nights

Photons to Photos Optical Bench Hub by Bill Claff

Red Book Nikkor Aid

Rolands Nikon Pages - Nikon Lens Serial Numbers and Manufacturing Dates

Marco Cavina's Website

Articles by Marco Cavina

Contributing

If you notice a mistake or have a better patent for a given lens, or want to add more lenses to this list, please send me a pull request at the github source repository for this page. You can also submit an issue.

Fish-eye Lenses

Lens name Patent number Inventors Year Remarks Fisheye-Nikkor 6mm f/2.8 US 3737214 Yoshiyuki Shimizu 1970 AF-S Fisheye NIKKOR 8-15mm f/3.5-4.5 E ED JP 2017-068114A Haruo Sato 2015 Note that this patent describes a 8-15mm fisheye lens which seems very close to but not exactly the same as the production lens. Nikon AF Fisheye-Nikkor 10.5mm f/2.8G ED US7161746B2 Keiko Mizuguchi 2003

TOSHI, Taeko 2023 NIKKOR-H Auto 2.8cm f/3.5 JP,38-026133,B(1963) WAKIMOTO, Zenji 1958 Tale 12 - Little lens, Big step, the story of 28mm f3.5 AIS Nikkor 28mm f/3.5 US 4099850A Sei Matsui 1976 This is the revised version of 28mm f/3.5 introduced around 1977. Nikkor-N Auto 28mm f/2 US 3736049 Yoshiyuki Shimizu 1970 AI Nikkor 28mm f/2.8 US 3635546 Ikuo Mori 1970 For the AIS version apparently this lens was redesigned by Daijiro Fujie in late 1970s. Nikon E-series 28mm f/2.8 US 4203653 Ikuo Mori 1977 AIS Nikkor 28mm f/2.8 Patent number tbc Daijiro Fujie Year tbc Tale 57 - The story of Nikkor 28mm f2.8 AIS

The design of this lens may be evident from a different patent by Kenzaburo Suzuki - US5917663A.

Marco Cavina's page on 28mm design appears to depit the design from above patent.

Standard Lenses

Lens name Patent number Inventors Year Remarks NIKKOR Z 40mm f/2 JP2021-189351A tbc 2020 AI Nikkor 45mm f/2.8P pancake for FM3 JP2003005030A (B2) OSHITA KOICHI 2003 Tale 78 - A pancake lens for FM3A Nikkor 50mm f/1.1 (rangefinder) US 2828671A Murakami Saburo 1957 Tale 7 - NIKKOR-N 5cm F1.1 Story

Japanese patent JP,39-008149,Y(1964) Nikkor-S Auto 50mm f/1.4 (F mount) US 3560079 Zenji Wakimoto

Yoshiyuki Shimizu 1964 Tale 44 - Nikkor-S Auto 50mm F1.4 Story Nikkor 50mm f/1.2 (tbc) US 3738736 Yoshiyuki Shimizu 1970 It is possible that this patent describes the 50mm f/1.2 Nikkor, which was only introduced in 1978.

A Japanese patent also applied in 1970 that might be associated is JP,54-043386,B(1979) AIS Nikkor 50mm f/1.8 US 4234242 Soichi Nakamura 1978 Take 60 - Story of the 50mm f/1.8 AIS AIS Nikkor 50mm f/1.4 US 4448497 Koichi Wakamiya 1981 NIKKOR Z 50mm f/1.8 S WO2019220618A1 Saburo Masugi

Tomoyuki Sashima 2018 NIKKOR Z 50mm f/1.2 S WO2021241230A1 HARADA HIROKI 2021 AF-S Nikkor 58mm f/1.4G JP 2013-019993

JP-5761604 Haruo Sato 2011

This patent does not appear to match the production lens exactly - in particular the second aspherical element in the production lens is different from the one one in the patent.

PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a small optical system of smaller number of constituent elements, which has high performance and less coma especially sagittal coma aberration, and spherical aberration

NIKKOR Z 58mm f/0.95 S Noct WO2019229849A1

US20210208373A1 Keisuke Tsubonoya

Hiroki Harada

Take Toshinori 2018

I suspect neither is the primary patent for this lens Ai Nikkor 135mm f/2.8 AIS JP,50-062630,A(1975) tbc 1973 Nikon Series-E 135mm f2.8 US4303314A Sei Matsui 1979 Nikkor Tale 76 Ai Nikkor 135mm f/2 AIS JP,52-055524,A(1977)

YAMAMOTO, Hiroshi

KURIBAYASHI, Tomonori

ONO, Takuro 2023 Nikkor 200mm f/2.0 ED-IF US 4176913 Soichi Nakamura

Kiyoshi Hayashi 1977 AF-S Nikkor 200mm f/2G VR US 7411745 Mitsuaki Wada 2004 First Nikkor lens to feature Super ED glass vd=91.0, nd=1.44. ED glass is typically vd=82.6, nd=1.49 or vd=81.6, nd=1.49. Nikkor-ED 300mm f/4.5 US3774991A Yoshiyuki Shimizu 1970 Patent also describes 600mm f5.6, 800mm f8 and 1200mm f11. Image of the lens at https://www.destoutz.ch/lens_300mm_f4.5_173317.html

Also see US4154508A that describes the 300mm f4.5 along with tele-converter.

Also see JP-S51-043917 1974

Also see Marco Cavina's nice article on the 300mm f4.5 lenses. Nikkor 300mm f/2.0 ED-IF US 4732459 Kiyoshi Hayashi 1987 AF-I Nikkor 300mm f2.8 ED-IF US 5253112A Kenzaburo Suzuki

Yoshinari Hamanishi 1991 This is actually a patent for teleconverter

Also see US4978205A by Susumo Sato AF-S Nikkor 300mm f/2.8 ED-IF II US 5745306A

Also see US5323270A Susumu Sato 1995 Tale 67 of Nikkor 1001 nights describes the work done by Susumu Sato for super telephoto lenses. AF-S NIKKOR 300mm f/4E PF ED VR JP 2015-172711A, Patent JP,6387631,B Makoto Fujimoto 2014 Note that the patent appears to have a second diffractive surface which is not shown in the production lens. AF-S Nikkor 400mm f/2.8D IF-ED II US 6239919B1 Susumu Sato 1998 AF-S NIKKOR 400mm f/2.8G ED VR US 2008-0158694 Kazunori Ohno 2006 This patent is held by Fujinon Corp. Toshinori Take

Seems closely related patent. AF-S NIKKOR 500mm f/4G ED VR US 2009-0190239 Takashi Suzuki 2008 This patent is held by Fujinon Corp. AF-S NIKKOR 500mm f/4E FL ED VR JP 2015-215560A Yamashita Masafumi

Sato Haruo 2009 See figure 4 Zoom Nikkor 35-70mm f3.5 US4266860A Kiyoshi Hayashi 1978 This page has a beautiful animation of the zoom operation of this lens AF Nikkor 35-70mm f2.8D US 6320698B1 Kenzaburo Suzuki 1993 Described in Nikkor 1001 nights - tale 39. The patent here is not by the original inventor Kiyotaka Inadome Nikon AI Zoom-Nikkor 35-105mm f/3.5-4.5S US 4699475A Tomowaki Takahashi

Yasuhiro Aono 1981 Tale 71 - A normal zoom lens redesigned to be more compact Nikon AI Zoom-Nikkor 35-200mm f/3.5-4.5S US 4770511A Yasuo Yonezawa

Yasuhiro Aono

Tomowaki Takahashi 1984 Tale 47 - Nikon's first high powered zoom lens 38-105mm zoom lens in Zoom 700 VR US 5530593A Atsushi Shibayama

Susumu Sato 1992 Nikon's first VR lens appeared in a compact camera Zoom 700 VR AI Zoom-Nikkor 50-135mm f/3.5S US 4497547A Kiyoshi Hayashi 1981 Tale 61 AI Zoom-Nikkor 50-300mm f/4.5 US 4189213A Yutaka Iizuka 1976 Nice animated diagram of the len is available at this site. Auto Zoom Nikkor 80-200mm f/4.5 (first version) US 3615125 Takashi Higuchi

Soichi Nakamura 1967 First of the 80-200mm zoom lenses from Nikon; the start of the series that has evolved to the 70-200mm zooms AI Nikkor 80-200mm f/4.5 (second version) US 4223981 Norio Mizutani

Yoshinari Hamanishi 1977 The 80-200mm f/4.5 lens reputedly established the Zoom lens as a viable tool. This was the second version of the lens. Nikkor 80-200mm f/4 AIS US 4452513 Yoshinari Hamanishi 1981 Redesigned with f/4 max aperture.

Also contains design for 200-400mm f/4. AI Zoom Nikkor 80-200mm f/2.8 ED US 4468097 Yoshinari Hamanishi 1981 First 80-200mm design with f/2.8 max aperture. 2 ED elements. AF Zoom Nikkor 80-200mm f/2.8 ED JP 1987-108218 Yoshinari Hamanishi 1985 Also see US 5579171. The design of the AF-D lens is in figure 3. 3 ED elements. It seems that the design allowed for VR function. AF-S Zoom-Nikkor 80-200mm f/2.8D IF-ED JP 2000-019398 Susumu Sato 1998 Tale 67 - the first lens from Nikon with AFS technology. Five ED elements.

Link to Japan Patent site AF-S NIKKOR 70-200mm f/4G ED VR US 20170315337 A1 Satoshi Yamaguchi

Issei Tanaka 2012 NIKKOR Z 70-200mm f/2.8 VR S WO2020105104A1

US20210349293A1 UEHARA TAKERU 2018 Nikkor Z version AF-P NIKKOR 70-300mm f/4.5-5.6E ED VR WO2018092297A1

US20190353880A1 Kosuke Machida 2016 AF Zoom Nikkor 80-400mm f/4.5-5.6D ED VR US 6141156 Masayuki Aoki 1998 Tale 35 - Nikon's first SLR lens with Vibration Reduction. AF-S NIKKOR 80-400mm f/4.5-5.6G ED VR US11221469B2

US20200049962A1 Tomoki Ito 2013 Japanese patent JP6198098B2 AF-S NIKKOR 120-300mm f/2.8E FL ED SR VR JP2020177057A TAKE TOSHINORI

YAMASHITA MASAFUMI 2019 Nikkor 200-400mm f/4 AIS US 4452513 Yoshinari Hamanishi 1981 Also contains design for 80-200mm f/4. AF-S NIKKOR 200-400mm f/4G ED VR US20050157403A1 Susumu Sato 2003 Optical design of version II remained the same. AF-S NIKKOR 200-500mm f/5.6 E ED VR JP2014209144A Taku Matsuo

Takeshi Suzuki

Haruo Sato
